oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Apparition seen by the party returning from the burial of the narrator s wife; followed by the account of an apparition seen, on another occasion, by the narrator s brother in law. In the Katkop dialect, by D !kw in (L V.

5832). Dia!kwain and his people were returning from burying his wife when they saw an apparition that resembled Dia!kwain's wife. He believed it to be something that appears at the time when sorcerers take people away. Dia!kwain's brother
law, Mansse, also saw an apparition on the hunting
ground. Apparitions resemble people in some ways, but are also different.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Concerning apparitions (or How, when the first wife of Dia!kwain was buried, those returning to their homes saw the apparition of a little child)
